page.title: 02Austerlands 2
page.content: upon the nearby town. The few{shops that there are to be found mainly along the main road. There are still some{isolated farm {houses,}but some of these have been converted into superior type residences. Here the impression is of{peace and {quiet}with just the sounds of the countryside and the muffled sound of traffic on the main road. Farming is difficult and is confined to grazing for sheep,a few milk cows and pasture for fattening beef cattle; although most of the land is cultivated for hay for use as winter feed.The fields are divided by stone walls and on the higher pasture the moorland is always threatening to reclaim the land from cultivation.
